name: Amazon Security Lake
description: This plugin is used to deliver alerts, events and web transactions data to Amazon Security Lake platform. To access the plugin, you would need the credentials of Amazon Security Lake instance.

configuration.label: Authentication Method
configuration.description: Select the method to be used for AWS client authentication.

configuration.label: AWS Access Key ID (Public Key)
configuration.description: AWS Access Key ID for AWS client authentication. Required for 'AWS Secret Credentials' authentication type.

configuration.label: AWS Secret Access Key (Private Key)
configuration.description: AWS Secret Access Key for AWS client authentication. Required for 'AWS Secret Credentials' authentication type.

configuration.label: Private Key File
configuration.description: Private Key File for decrypting the AWS Private CA Certificate. Required for 'AWS IAM Roles Anywhere' authentication type.

configuration.label: Certificate Body
configuration.description: Certificate Body for AWS Public/Private CA Certificate. Required for 'AWS IAM Roles Anywhere' authentication type.

configuration.label: Password Phrase
configuration.description: Password Phrase for decrypting the CA Certificate. Required for 'AWS IAM Roles Anywhere' authentication type.

configuration.label: Profile ARN
configuration.description: AWS Profile ARN for AWS client authentication. Required for 'AWS IAM Roles Anywhere' authentication type.

configuration.label: Role ARN
configuration.description: AWS Role ARN for AWS client authentication. Required for 'AWS IAM Roles Anywhere' authentication type.

configuration.label: Trust Anchor ARN
configuration.description: AWS Trust Anchor ARN for AWS client authentication. Required for 'AWS IAM Roles Anywhere' authentication type.

configuration.label: Region Name
configuration.description: Region Name from where to get an S3 Bucket. Make sure that the region name matches the region in the Profile ARN and Trust Anchor ARN.

configuration.label: Bucket Name
configuration.description: Bucket Name in which the data object will be stored. Note: If bucket with the specified name does not exists in the selected region then new bucket will be created.
